page.title: 01The Retford Area
page.content: Retford lies on the eastern edge of {Sherwood Forest}in the district if {Bassetlaw.} The village of Retford is recorded in the 1086 Survey.The settlement probably takes its name from a{ford {across the river Idle} over the red rocks. In 1246 Retford was granted its Charter by Henry III.The Great North Road was routed through the {market {town}in 1766.The building of the { {Chesterfield Canal}in 1777 and the coming of the East_West,North_South {Railways}in 1849 stimulated economic and population growth into the 20th century. The market town is{centrally located} between Sheffield,Doncaster,Lincoln and Nottingham,an ideal{dormitory {town.}
